editionStmt.edition: Digital edition according to TEI P5

availability.licence: This document is published under the Creative Commons licence Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De natura rerum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Bede presbyteri de naturis rerum.

msItem.incipit: Naturas rerum uarias lanetis et aeui
msItem.explicit: Qui legis astra super mente tuere diem.

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de quadrifario opere dei.
msItem.incipit: Operatio diuina quae secula creauit et gubernat
msItem.explicit: usque ad meridiem atque inde africa a ameridie usque ad occidentem extenditur.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de natura rerum uenerabilis bedae presbyteri.

msItem.decoNote: Red initials and rubricated titles. Manicula as in f. 3r, 5v etc.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De temporum ratione
msItem.incipit: De natura rerum et ratione temporum duos quondam stricto sermone libellos
msItem.explicit: eternam cuncti celestium praemiorum mereamut accipere palmam.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit domino iuvante bede presbyteri liber de temporibus feliciter.
msItem.note: Many contemporary interlienar glosses to the first chapters (untill f.29r).
msItem.decoNote: Decorated initials on ff. 9v, 11v. Diagram on f. 18v illustrating the shadow cast onto the moon during night.

msItem.title: Excerptum de astronomia
msItem.incipit: Duo sunt extremi uertices mundi quos appelant polos

msItem.title: De ordine ac positione stellarum in signis
msItem.incipit: Est quidem hic ordo posicioque syderum quae caelo plurium coaceruatione stellarum insignum

msItem.author: Ps-Priscian
msItem.title: De sideribus
msItem.incipit: Ad boree arcturi partes uertuntur et anguis
msItem.explicit: Hinc sequitur pistrix simul heridanique fluenta.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation with pencil at the top right corner of every folium.
supportDesc.collation: Quire mark (?) on f. 112v in the lower margin.

condition.p: Holes in the parchment partly sewed up.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 30 long lines. Blind ruling with prikings visible in the outher margin. Red rubrics and initials.

physDesc.additions: On f.115v a charter transcript about a gift made by Burkards von Mureck to the monastery St. Lambrecht. Published by Johann Loserth, "Kleine steiermärkische Nekrologien und nekrologische Notizen," in Beiträge zur Kunde steiermärkischer Geschichtsquellen 26 (1894): 3-20.

binding.p: Gothic leather binding (probably s. XIV). The binding was renewed in August 1958 by bookbinder Kümmler, who added two clasps (see note in pencil on f. 115v).

history.origin: The manuscript was written ins. XII1 , probably in the Benedictine monastery of St. Lambrecht. See the exlibris on the front paste-down Librum istum sancti lamberti et fratrum eius quisquis ui uel furto abstulerit anathema sit (s. XII2.

listBibl.head: Selected Bibliography:
listBibl.bibl: Wonisch, Othmar. "Die St. Lambrechter Handschriftenverzeichnisse."Neue Chronik zur Geschichte und Volkskunde der Innerösterreichischen Alpenländer 7 (1962): 2.
Kern, Anton.Die Handschriften der Universitätsbibliothek Graz, Vol. 1. Leipzig: Harrassowitz, 1939, p. 165.
Wonisch, Othmar. "Die St. Lambrecht-Grazer Handschriften."Zentralblatt für Bibliothekswesen 35 (1918): 64-73.
